sen.e: FUJIARA no Norinaga (1109 - 1180) was a noble who lived the late Heian Period.

sen.j: 難波飛鳥井流の始祖・権大納言藤原忠教の四男。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of FUJIWARA no Yorisuke, who was the founder of Nanba-Asukai school and Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).

sen.j: 母は民部卿源俊明の娘。

sen.j: 右中将、参議、左京大夫などを歴任する一方、歌人・能書家としてもその名を知られ、藤原忠通の書の師範を務めたほどであった。
sen.e: While he held various positions such as Uchujo/Ukone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sangi (Royal Advisors) and Sakyo no Daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) in succession, he was known as a tanka poet and a person with good handwriting and he taught penmanship to FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.

sen.e: He was promoted smoothly and promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in 1149, which position was the highest one he attained.

sen.j: 保元元年（1156年）に勃発した保元の乱に際しては、崇徳上皇・藤原頼長に加担。
sen.e: On the occasion of the Hogen Disturbance in 1156, he joined the plot of the Retired Emperor Sutoku and FUJIARA no Yorinaga.

sen.j: 源為義に対して再三の説得工作を行い自軍に参加させるなど、中心的な役割を担った。
sen.e: He played a leading role and, for example, repeatedly tried to persuade MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi and succeeded to make him join to his side.

sen.j: 上皇方の敗北後は出家（法名は親蓮あるいは観蓮）・投降し、恭順の意を示したが、赦されず常陸国に配流となった。
sen.e: After the defeat of the Retired Emperor, he became a priest (his homyo (Buddhist name) was Shinren or Kanren) and surrendered and signaled his allegiance but he was not forgiven and exiled to Hitachi Province.

sen.j: その後、安元年間（1175年 - 1177年）において鹿ケ谷の陰謀や安元の大火といった大事件が相次いだ際には、崇徳や頼長を神霊として祀り、その祟りを鎮めるべきである、と主張したという。
sen.e: Later, in the Angen era (1175 through 1177), when serious incidents such as the Shishigatani Affair and the great fire of Angen occurred in n succession, he reportedly insisted to worship Sutoku and Yorinaga as gods to calm down their divine wrath..
